answers.answer: Hi,This could be due to recurrent bouts of inflammation of the glans, called balanitis.Balanitis causes symptoms of redness, soreness and itching on the end of the penis.Older males are also affected, most commonly with the yeast Candida albicans, which causes thrush. Little red spots appear and there may be a build-up of yeasty smegma under the foreskin. Screening of the urine is important to exclude sugar diabetes, in which balanitis is often the first sign.Other causes of balanitis include infection with common skin bacteria, fungus or chemical irritation.Moderate to severe balanitis due to thrush needs treatment with an anti-fungal cream (e.g. clotrimazole). Since Monistat is helping you , you could continue with the same.ref:http://www.tiscali.co.uk/lifestyle/healthfitness/menshealth/part1_1-2.html
